info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 12:18PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Santa Cruz County through 100 PM MST... At 1218 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Patagonia, or 19 miles east of Nogales, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly remote areas of east central Santa Cruz County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
